options.fig-cap: Illustration of a confounding variable.  The confounder, related to both the response and the factor of interest (or treatment) can make it appear as though there is a causal relationship when none exists.
options.label: unnamed-chunk-11

options.fig-cap: Illustration of the impact of random assignment in study design.  For the observational study, the treatment groups are unbalanced.  For the controlled experiment, the treatment groups are balanced.
options.label: unnamed-chunk-12
